Author: jl777c#5810
Content: how do i know when to use E ?

Author: zawy#5864
Content: Always, if R is not triggered.....but the diff it uses post-R should not be such a wild value as R, but what D outputs at that time.  Actually, D is never used in this idea since I want a penalty on attacker's first block....this means every block has to vary a lot based on tipdiff

Author: zawy#5864
Content: but have digi in background as input to RST for non-RST values (else RST uses ctB), and always as input to E

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: i tried E active priot to RST, but it adapted pretty fast and RST rarely triggered. probably need looser triggers in that setup

Author: zawy#5864
Content: nBits should remain like it is.

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: but then i switched to all three RST active and it worked so well, i put the EMA at the end to not change the good RST behavior
